content.question: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. The following table shows the annual income, in dollars, and amount spent on vacation, in dollars, for a sample of 8 families. Income 41,100 53,000 27,400 34,400 65,800 98,100 72,000 56,700 Vacation 2,700 2,400 1,700 2,500 2,800 5,100 4,200 3,200 (a) Create a scatterplot of the data in the table.

frqParts.text: Show all your work. Indicate clearly the methods you use, because you will be scored on the correctness of your methods as well as on the accuracy and completeness of your results and explanations. The following table shows the annual income, in dollars, and amount spent on vacation, in dollars, for a sample of 8 families. Income 41,100 53,000 27,400 34,400 65,800 98,100 72,000 56,700 Vacation 2,700 2,400 1,700 2,500 2,800 5,100 4,200 3,200 (a) Create a scatterplot of the data in the table.
(b) Describe the association shown in the scatterplot created in part (a).
(c) Calculate the coefficient of determination for the data, and interpret the value in context.

topic.text: 2.4: Representing the Relationship Between Two Quantitative Variables

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Describe data presented numerically or graphically.
